root_causes: Wrong variable referenced: script uses B5eDKx5 but expected item variable is B5eDKx5_5 (multi item variables use item suffix).
Validation targets the parent/multi name instead of the specific item; multi-item response must validate the item variable (B5eDKx5_5).
Unclear handling of multi/checkbox format — script does not treat this as a specific item code presence check.
instructions: Change the variable used in the validation to the item variable B5eDKx5_5 (not B5eDKx5).
Validate the item variable directly. For example: temporary. sel if miss(B5eDKx5_5) or ~range(B5eDKx5_5,5,5). list respid B5eDKx5_5.
If you prefer explicit equality, use: sel if miss(B5eDKx5_5) or (B5eDKx5_5 <> 5). list respid B5eDKx5_5.

If special codes (97/98/99 or other survey-specific codes) apply for this item, include them in the allowed set/filter (e.g. treat them as valid or exclude them explicitly) — update the sel if logic accordingly.

root_causes: Script references variable 'B5eDKx5' but expected variable ID is 'B5eDKx5_5' (item-level variable for the checkbox/answer code 5).
instructions: Use the item-level variable name B5eDKx5_5 in the validation and output lines instead of B5eDKx5. For example: sel if miss(B5eDKx5_5) or ~any(B5eDKx5_5,5). list respid, B5eDKx5_5.

If your checkbox/item variable uses different coding for checked (e.g. 1 for checked), update the any(...) test to the actual coded value for the item. (The expected metadata lists answer code 5 — ensure the SPSS item variable matches that code.)

If your project uses special codes (97/98/99) for this item, add explicit handling to exclude or accept those codes as appropriate (e.g. include them in the any(...) allowed set or handle them separately).
